title: Lizzo accused of copyright infringing CeCe Peniston’s song for Juice
text:
Lizzo may have a lawsuit on her hands after being accused of copyright infringing CeCe Peniston’s hit nineties single, Finally, for her own hit Juice.

The 31-year-old singer, real name Melissa Vivanne Jefferson, released Juice in January and, although it didn’t set the charts on fire, it’s received endless airplay on TV, radio and pretty much everywhere else.

But the song has now been the subject of accusations of copyright infringement.

CeCe, who released Finally back in 1992, claims Juice features similar elements in the ad-libs.

The 50-year-old shared a side-by-side comparison of a specific part of Juice where Lizzo sings ‘ya-ya-ee, ya-ya-ee’, alongside a part of her song where she sings ‘finally’.

In the caption, CeCe wrote alongside her Instagram post: ‘@bendaworld sent me this video and this is a clear example of #copyrightinfringementCece Peniston versus @lizzobeeatingy’all check this out and btw I love her music #tbt #juice #absolutvodka#finally #thetea #royalties#atlanticrecords #umpg #lizzo#lizzojuice #intellectualproperty.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Hopeful of reconciling the issue without a nasty legal fight, CeCe later added: ‘This is a really a sensitive issue ..I love #lizzos music and artistry , my concern is that lyrics and melody that I wrote in my song #finally are now a part of her song “ juice “ and I would like for us to resolve this in a positive manner [sic].’

Lizzo is yet to respond to the claims but it’s not the first time the singer has been accused of copyright infringement.

Songwriter and producer Justin Raisen recently accused Lizzo of lifting the opening line, melody and chords of her latest single, Truth Hurts, from a song they’d written together earlier this year titled Healthy.

The opening line that has become a popular catchphrase goes: ‘I just a DNA test, turns out I’m 100% that b***h.’

In an Instagram post, Justin said: ‘We were never contacted about being credited for the use of the parts of ‘Healthy.

‘We’ve tried to sort this out quietly for the last two years, only asking for 5% each but were shutdown every time [sic].’

Lizzo is currently celebrating the success of Truth Hurts which has earned the singer her first number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Metro.co.uk have contacted Lizzo’s reps for comment.

description: CeCe Peniston has accused Lizzo of copyright infringing her hit 1992 single Finally for her song Juice.
